description: [World Bank] STORY HIGHLIGHTS
title: Africa: Revolutionizing Livestock Farming in Cameroon - the Power of Productive Partnerships

description: [WHO] We, the member countries of the Group of Friends of the WHO Academy, reaffirm our commitment to support the WHO Academy, an essential tool for strengthening the skills and competencies of human resources for health, in order to achieve universal health coverage and increase global access to quality health services.
title: Africa: Strengthening the Training of Health And Care Workers to Build Resilient Health Systems

description: [ENA] Addis Ababa -- The Embassy of Ethiopia in Algeria organized an exclusive event to introduce Ethiopia's world-renowned coffee to Femoca Coffee, one of Algeria's leading coffee importers.
title: Africa: Ethiopia's Ambassador Stresses Importance of Leveraging Strong Pan-African Bond

description: [ISS] The Chagos Archipelago dispute is a microcosm of the broader tensions shaping global maritime geopolitics.
title: Africa: No Easy Courses for Chagos Consensus On Sovereignty and Security

description: [Vanguard] With recent worldwide heatwaves across the globe exceeding temperature records and exposing the impact of climate change, some of the hottest countries, from tropical savannas to scorching deserts, are currently experiencing extreme heat throughout the year.
title: Africa: Top 10 Hottest Countries in the World

description: [IFRC] In Adamawa, a state in northeastern Nigeria, life can be tough. Even simple acts to maintain basic health can pose a challenge due to a lack of awareness and resources. With the help of volunteers from the Nigerian Red Cross, the Reach Initiative is changing that, one hand-washing at a time.
title: Africa: Reach Initiative - How a Simple Act Can Have a Revolutionary Impact On Family Health

description: [Ethiopian Herald] Drought and famine occur in our country at least every 10 years. Establishing the trend and/or frequency of such natural environmental disasters is helpful in preparing for future prevention of similar catastrophes. Based on climate data obtained from trees, scientists say that drought has been plaguing our country since at least the 18th century.
title: Africa: Trees Have Archived Centuries of Climate Data That Determine Our Future

description: [allAfrica] While vaping is not entirely harm-free, it is a scientifically proven tool for reducing the harm from tobacco combustion and, in some cases, an effective smoking cessation aid. In the United Kingdom (UK), public health efforts are increasingly focused on addressing youth vaping as a public health concern.
title: Africa: Vaping Policies Could Have Unintended Consequences on Youth Smoking Behavior

description: [allAfrica] With just five years remaining until Philip Morris International's (PMI) 2030 smoke-free target, aiming for over two-thirds of the company's revenue to come from smoke-free products, PMI is optimistic about achieving this goal right on schedule.
title: Africa: Technovation 2024 Highlights PMI's Progress Toward Smoke-Free Future

description: [IPS] Riyadh &amp; Hyderabad -- The 16th meeting of the Conference of the Parties to the UN Convention to Combat Desertification (UNCCD COP 16) concluded early hours of Saturday with a renewed focus on building drought resilience globally. However, the COP also failed to agree on bringing a legally binding drought protocol. Like the biodiversity and climate change COPs held earlier in the year, COP16 also failed to finish in time and ended by postponing several key decisions to COP17 scheduled to be held in 2026.
title: Africa: UNCCD COP16 Spotlights Drought but Fails to Agree On a Legally Binding Protocol

description: [Premium Times] About 95 per cent of these deaths were concentrated in Africa
title: Africa: 263 Million Malaria Cases, 597,000 Deaths Recorded Globally in 2023 - WHO

description: [The Conversation Africa] Dolphins have an irresistible charm for people. They are extremely playful at all ages and often play alone, surfing the waves, leaping into the air, performing flips and striking the water with their tail flukes.
title: Africa: Bottlenose Dolphins Smile At Each Other When They Play - New Study Reveals How and Why

description: [CAF] AS FAR's Doha El Madani has been voted the best young player of the year in the women's category at the 2024 CAF Awards.

description: [CAF] Head coach of the reigning African champions, Emerse Fae has been voted the best coach in the men's category at the 2024 CAF Awards on Monday evening.
title: Africa: Emerse Fae Crowned Coach of the Year

description: [CAF] Lamia Boumehdi was voted the Coach of the Year in the Women's category of the 2024 CAF Awards on Monday evening.

description: [UN News] As the world navigates rapid digital transformation, the 19th United Nations Internet Governance Forum (IGF) has convened in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, under the theme "Building Our Multistakeholder Digital Future."
title: Africa: Internet Governance Forum - Shaping a Safe and Equitable Digital Future

description: [UN News] UN humanitarians expressed alarm on Monday at the rising numbers of civilian casualties in and around the besieged Sudanese city of El Fasher, in northern Darfur.
title: Africa: World News in Brief - Death Toll Rises in Darfur, Cyclone Chido Latest, São Tomé and Príncipe Takes Development Step

description: [RFI] Ademola Lookman and Barbra Banda were respectively anointed on Monday night as the Confederation of African Football's men's and women's player of the year at a lavish awards ceremony in Marrakech.
title: Africa: Lookman and Banda Named African Players of the Year

description: [Nile Post] Despite significant strides in controlling and preventing malaria, the disease continues to claim nearly 600,000 lives annually, with children in Africa bearing the brunt of this preventable scourge, the Gates Foundation emphasised in a statement following the release of the World Health Organization's (WHO) World Malaria Report.
title: Africa: Gates Foundation Highlights Malaria's Toll On Africa and Uganda

description: [New Times] The airline industry in Africa is expected to generate $200m net profit in 2025, an increase from an estimated $0.1 billion in 2024, according to the latest report by the International Air Transport Association (IATA).
title: Africa: Africa's Airline Industry Forecast to Generate $200m Profit in 2025

description: [UNDP] A contribution to peace in the Arab States and North Africa
title: Africa: Linking Decent Work and the Humanitarian-Development-Peace Nexus

description: [RFI] France is rushing aid to help the Indian Ocean territory of Mayotte by ship and military aircraft after the island was devastated by Cyclone Chido - the worst storm to hit the region in nearly a century.
title: Africa: Relief Efforts Stepped Up in Mayotte As Cyclone Chido Death Toll Set to Soar

description: [IFJ] The One-day Forum brought together 12 editors from various media houses including newspapers, community radio stations, private radio and television stations, the state media and online media editors as well as media trainers from the GPU.
title: Africa: GPU Holds National Forum With Editors to Improve Migration Reporting

description: [CAF] Nigeria forward Ademola Lookman, Zambia striker Barbra Banda and South Africa goalkeeper Ronwen Williams were the big winners at a star-studded 2024 CAF Awards in Marrakech, Morocco on Monday as Africa's best performers for the year were honoured.
title: Africa: Lookman, Banda and Williams Are Big Winners At 2024 CAF Awards in Marrakech, Morocco

description: [The Conversation Africa] Black adults living with long COVID pointed to challenges with their physical health - rather than their mental health - when asked to describe their long-COVID symptoms. That is one key finding from our new study, published in the Journal of Racial and Ethnic Health Disparities.
title: Africa: Black Adults With Long Covid Report Higher Levels of Hopelessness and Suicidal Thoughts - New Research

description: [Afropop] In the tense summer of 1962, in a dimly lit bar on the outskirts of Oran, Algeria, revolution wore an unexpected face. Cheikha Rimitti stepped onto the stage, her shoulder deliberately bared in the style that had earned singers like her the scandalous title "women of the cold shoulder." The conservative audience shifted uneasily - not just because of her presence, but because of what that presence represented. In French colonial Algeria, where women were forbidden from public performance, the very
title: Africa: The Deepest Roots of Revolution - How Six Musicians Transformed African Music

description: [IPS] Dakar, Senegal -- From increased pests and diseases to lower crop yields and extreme weather events, the adverse impacts of climate change on agriculture in Africa cannot be overstated.
title: Africa: How an African Bioeconomy Can Strengthen Agrifood Systems in the Context of a Changing Climate

description: [IPS] Dublin, Ireland -- For decades, preventable deaths, lifelong disabilities, and disfigurements presented devastating consequences for over 90% of the population in Africa, where surgical care remains largely out of reach.
title: Africa: Bridging the Gap in Africa's Surgical Care Crisis

description: [African Arguments] Debating Ideas reflects the values and editorial ethos of the African Arguments book series, publishing engaged, often radical, scholarship, original and activist writing from within the African continent and beyond. It offers debates and engagements, contexts and controversies, and reviews and responses flowing from the African Arguments books. It is edited and managed by the International African Institute, hosted at SOAS University of London, the owners of the book series of the same name.
title: Africa: Child Care in Africa - Sierra Leone's Early Years Experiences

description: [Africa CDC] In a small rural clinic in Africa, a mother cradles her feverish child as a doctor delivers a troubling prognosis: the antibiotics aren't working. The bacteria causing the infection appears to have become resistant. Once unimaginable, this reality underscores the growing threat of antimicrobial resistance (AMR), now a silent but formidable health crisis across Africa.
title: Africa: The Hidden Pandemic Threatening Africa's Progress
